text: Bhogadi is a census town in Mysore district in the state of Karnataka, India. Bhogadi is one of the biggest villages in Mysore district. It is also popular for its culture and there are many temples, churches, and mosques around it. ==Demographics== India census, Bhogadi had a population of 4813. Males constitute 53% of the population and females 47%. Bhogadi has an average literacy rate of 64%, higher than the national average of 59.5%; with male literacy of 70% and female literacy of 57%. 11% of the population is under 6 years of age. ==Important landmarks== * Hari Vidyalaya, Bhogadi * Amrita Vidyalayam, Bhogadi * SBI Bank, Bhogadi * Mataji Bhandar * Railway Layot * Bank employees colony * Haridra Ganesha Temple * Bhogeswara temple * Swamy arcade, Bhogadi * CFTRI LAYOUT ==See also== * Bhogadi road * Raja Rajeshwari Nagar, Mysore Amritakripa Hospital ==Image gallery== File:Sharada Public School, Mysore.jpg|Sharada Public School File:Bogadi Hari Vidyalaya.jpg|Hari Vidyalaya File:Bogadi Temple.jpg|Temple in Bhogadi File:Bogadi Ringroad Junction.jpg|Ringroad File:T.K.Layout2.jpg|T.K.Layout ==References== Category:Cities and towns in Mysore district
